content.body:
> <@stephenhicks:matrix.org> The zalgo situation is the most concerning part. I'd be more comfortable if it's statically determined per API. So something like - lifecycle callbacks are always unwrapped, events are always wrapped. Unwrapped callbacks have an opt-out by manually wrapping them. Wrapped callbacks _may_ have an opt-out via a snapshot property. I'm still not convinced that it's a problem to sometimes run a callback in the top-level/initial snapshot (e.g. if it's dispatched from the parser).

I don’t understand why running it in the top level snapshot wouldn’t also amount to Zalgo to the same extent as using the registration context is
